intro: Bupleurum bicaule subsp. bicaule, commonly known as the two-stemmed bugloss, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and slender, branching stems. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers in clusters during the spring and early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone areas. Its medicinal properties have been historically recognized in traditional herbal practices.
